Complete Guide

Finance Career Guide

Investment banking, private equity, hedge funds—understand the paths, compensation, and what it actually takes to break in.

View PlaybooksCompare Paths

The Major Finance Career Paths

Investment Banking

Advise companies on M&A, debt, and equity transactions

Entry:Campus recruiting or lateral
Hours:80-100/week
Comp:$150K-$200K all-in (1st year)
Exits:PE, HF, Corp Dev, MBA

Pros

  • +Deal experience
  • +Exit optionality
  • +Technical skills

Cons

  • -Brutal hours
  • -Junior work can be tedious
  • -High burnout

Private Equity

Acquire and improve companies using leverage

Entry:2 years of IB typically required
Hours:60-80/week
Comp:$300K-$400K all-in (Associate)
Exits:Operating roles, MBA, HF, stay in PE

Pros

  • +Ownership mindset
  • +Better hours than IB
  • +High comp

Cons

  • -Competitive entry
  • -Long fundraising cycles
  • -Limited seats

Hedge Funds

Generate alpha through various investment strategies

Entry:IB, ER, or direct from undergrad
Hours:50-70/week
Comp:$200K-$500K+ (varies wildly)
Exits:Launch own fund, family office, different HF

Pros

  • +Investment focus
  • +P&L ownership
  • +Uncapped upside

Cons

  • -High pressure
  • -Performance-based job security
  • -Competitive

Equity Research

Analyze public companies and publish investment recommendations

Entry:Campus recruiting or from IB
Hours:55-70/week
Comp:$150K-$250K all-in
Exits:Hedge funds, Corp development, IR

Pros

  • +Investment focus
  • +External profile
  • +Better hours than IB

Cons

  • -MiFID impact
  • -Less comp than IB
  • -Industry shrinking

2026 Compensation Guide

These are approximate figures for top-tier firms. Compensation varies by firm, group, and year.

RoleBaseBonusTotal
IB Analyst 1$110K$90-140K$200-250K
IB Analyst 2$125K$100-170K$225-295K
IB Associate 1$175K$100-200K$275-375K
PE Associate 1$175K$125-200K+$300-375K+
HF Analyst$150-250K$200K-$1M+Varies wildly

The Finance Recruiting Timeline

Finance recruiting happens earlier than any other industry. Here's the roadmap.

Freshman

Explore finance, get good grades, join finance clubs

Sophomore

Land a sophomore internship, start networking, learn modeling

Junior

SA internship (this is THE recruiting cycle), convert to FT

Senior

Either you have an offer or you're lateral recruiting

Analyst 1-2

Learn the job, build skills, start thinking about exits

Exit

PE/HF recruiting typically happens in year 1-2 of banking

Skills You Need

Financial Modeling

3-statement models, DCF, LBO, merger models

Accounting

Deep understanding of financial statements and how they link

Valuation

Trading comps, transaction comps, DCF, LBO-based valuations

Excel/PPT

Speed and proficiency are table stakes—you must be fast

Communication

Client-facing work requires clear written and verbal skills

Work Ethic

The ability to grind through 100-hour weeks when needed
